sentences.english: I want all you children to finish up your dinners.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你们孩子们每人把你们自己的饭菜吃光。

sentences.english: Now you are in a tie, you shall have one more jump at the height.
sentences.chinese: 你们成绩相等，每人在这个高度再试跳一次。

sentences.english: We offered them each three cups of barley wine.
sentences.chinese: 我们敬了他们每人三杯青稞酒。

sentences.english: The waitress shows you to your table and gives you each a menu.
sentences.chinese: 女侍应便带你们到一张餐枱，并给你们每人一份菜单。

sentences.english: Some ancient cities had two to three times as much water per person as many cities today.
sentences.chinese: 某些古代城市每人的用水量是今日许多城市的两三倍。

sentences.english: This yields NT$18,000 or so of disposable income for each person in the household every month.
sentences.chinese: 得出家中每人每月可支配所得是一万八千多元。

sentences.english: Great reason temple officials' tent, everyone neutral one debt.
sentences.chinese: 大理寺官员营帐，每人独立一帐。

sentences.english: We gave each of the five children an equal share.
sentences.chinese: 我们给了这五个孩子每人均等的一份。

sentences.english: Each one of us will give you eleven hundred shekels of silver.
sentences.chinese: 我们就每人给你一千一百舍客勒银子。

sentences.english: Everyone agreed to kick in 50 cents for a present for the teacher.
sentences.chinese: 大家都同意每人缴付5角钱给老师买一件礼物。

sentences.english: She portioned out the cake, so everyone had a piece.
sentences.chinese: 她把馅饼分开，这样每人都得到一块。

sentences.english: Visa Fee of RMB 250 per applicant.
Everyone went into Molly's room to say good night, I think.
sentences.chinese: 我想，每人都到莫利的房间对他道晚安。

sentences.english: The teacher asked all the students to have a globe each.
sentences.chinese: 老师要求所有的学生每人都有一个地球仪。

sentences.english: Two boys entered, each was carring a suitcase.
sentences.chinese: 两个男孩走了进来，每人题提着一只箱子。

sentences.english: We went for some swimming crabs first, two for each, then we bought some hairy crabs and then two different shellfishes.
sentences.chinese: 先买了梭子蟹，每人两只，然后是大闸蟹和两种海贝。

definition: and so on/in a similar fashion
to receive/to be given/to be presented with
